channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Stocks Plunge Worldwide, and Trump Faces Mass Protests
item.description: Plus, Wayne Gretzky’s record finally falls.

item.title: Adrienne Adams Pitches Guaranteed Income as Major Campaign Proposal
item.description: Adrienne Adams, the New York City Council speaker who is running for mayor, will release a plan to provide guaranteed income for homeless families.

item.title: Crypto venture firms like Paradigm enjoy banner years, Multicoin posts 56% annual growth
item.description: New SEC filings show that crypto VCs had a massive bump in 2024.

item.title: Everything Is Going According to Plan
item.description: Will President Trump’s tariffs go down as one of the 100 worst decisions in presidential history? 50? 10?

item.title: Europe Is Ready to Make Its First Countermove to Trump Tariffs
item.description: European Union officials will vet and vote on a list of retaliatory tariffs this week, while contemplating what comes next.

item.title: Donald Trump shares video claiming he’s ‘purposefully crashing the market’—but then insists ‘he doesn’t want anything to go down’
item.description: President Trump then told media aboard Air Force One: "I don't want anything to go down, but sometimes you have to take medicine to fix something."

item.title: Thousands of North Korean IT workers have infiltrated the Fortune 500—and they keep getting hired for more jobs
item.description: “They are wildly successful,” said Google Threat Intelligence Group expert Michael Barnhart, who has been tracking North Korea and collecting intellig...

item.title: Boeing starts to face first civil trial over 2019 Ethiopian Airlines 737 MAX crash that killed 157
item.description: Relatives of 155 of the victims had sued Boeing between April 2019 and March 2021 for wrongful death, negligence and other charges.

item.title: Trump’s global tariffs paired with Elon Musk’s DOGE cuts could push the U.S. into ‘a far worse situation than 2008,’ Mark Cuban warns
item.description: Mark Cuban is warning that tariffs and DOGE cuts could result in long-term pain for the U.S. economy.

item.title: What We Know About the Case of Gaza Aid Workers Killed by Israeli Gunfire
item.description: The Israeli military, confronted with video evidence contradicting its initial account, now says it was “mistaken.”

item.title: What to Know About the Destructive Spring Storm System
item.description: Heavy rains, damaging winds and dangerous floods have ravaged the South and the Midwest for days, killing at least 18 people.

item.title: Ukraine Questions Value of Black Sea Truce With Russia
item.description: Ukrainian Navy officers and business owners in the port city pondered what Kyiv could gain from a truce after it pushed back Russian vessels and resum...

item.title: Europe Is Ready to Make Its First Countermove to Trump Tariffs
item.description: European Union officials will vet and vote on a list of retaliatory tariffs this week, while contemplating what comes next.

item.title: Live Updates: Stocks in Asia and Europe Plunge as Trump Says Tariffs Will Stay
item.description: U.S. markets were also set to open lower after President Trump said that he would not back off his trade war, reinforcing fears of a global economic d...

item.title: China Tries to Downplay the Trade War’s Effects on Its Economy
item.description: Faced with economic disruption, Beijing is presenting itself as too powerful to succumb to U.S. pressure. It is also censoring criticism at home.
